The CDC waited ‘its entire existence for this moment.’ What went wrong?The CDC made early testing mistakes that contributed to a cascade of problems that persist today. It failed to provide timely counts of infections and deaths, and it hesitated in absorbing the lessons of other countries, including the perils of silent carriers spreading the infection.
